contentrichtext.text: '''Richard Tousey''' (May 18, 1908 – April 15, 1997)<ref name=nyt>{{cite news| url=http://www.nytimes.com/1997/04/21/us/richard-tousey-88-solar-physicist.html | work=The New York Times | title=Richard Tousey, 88; Solar Physicist | date=21 April 1997}}</ref> was an [[United States|American]] [[astronomer]]. He was a pioneer in the observation of the [[sun]] from [[outer space|space]], and took the first photographs of the sun's [[ultraviolet]] spectrum, using a captured [[V-2|V-2 rocket]].<ref name=nyt /> In 1960 he was awarded the [http://www.osa.org/aboutosa/awards/osaawards/awardsdesc/ivesquinn/ Frederic Ives Medal] by the [[Optical Society of America|OSA.]] He won the [[Henry Draper Medal]] from the [[United States National Academy of Sciences|National Academy of Sciences]] in 1963,<ref name=Draper>{{cite web|title=Henry Draper Medal|url=http://www.nasonline.org/site/PageServer?pagename=AWARDS_draper|publisher=National Academy of Sciences|accessdate=24 February 2011}}</ref> the [[Eddington Medal]] in 1964, and the [[Henry Norris Russell Lectureship]] in 1966. ==References== <references/> ==External links== * [http://www.nap.edu/readingroom/books/biomems/rtousey.html National Academy of Sciences biography] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Tousey, Richard | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American astronomer | DATE OF BIRTH = May 18, 1908 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = April 15, 1997 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tousey, Richard}} [[Category:1908 births]] [[Category:1997 deaths]] [[Category:American astronomers]] [[Category:National Academy of Sciences laureates]] {{US-astronomer-stub}}
